crisp.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: something that is crisp is hard, and makes a pleasant sound when you break it or crush it
crisp.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: She kicked at the crisp leaves at her feet.
He stepped carefully through the crisp deep snow.
crisp.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: food that is crisp is pleasantly hard or firm when you bite it
crisp.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Cook the pastry until it is crisp and golden.
The meat should be nice and crisp on the outside.
crisp.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: paper or cloth that is crisp is fresh, clean, and new
crisp.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: weather that is crisp is cold and dry
crisp.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: The air was fresh and crisp.
The weather remained crisp and dry.
crisp.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: if someone behaves or speaks in a crisp way, they are confident, polite, and firm, but not very friendly
crisp.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: Her tone was crisp and businesslike.
crisp.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: a picture or sound that is crisp is clear
crisp.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: an old recording that still sounds remarkably crisp
crisp.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a very thin flat round piece of potato that is cooked in oil and eaten cold
crisp.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: to become crisp or make something become crisp by cooking or heating it
crisp.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: Cook the chicken until the skin is nicely crisped.
